name: 达妮埃尔·汤普森
awards: 1977年 第49届奥斯卡金像奖 最佳原创剧本 (提名) 表兄妹
name_full: 达妮埃尔·汤普森 Danièle Thompson
introduction: Danièle Thompson (born 3 January 1942) is a Monegasque film director and screenwriter. Thompson is the daughter of film director Gérard Oury, and actress Jacqueline Roman.Danièle ThompsonDanièle Thompson avp 2014.jpgThompson in 2014Born3 January 1942 (age 76)MonacoOccupationFilm director, screenwriterYears active1966–presentShe has written screenplays for a number of highly successful films including Cousin, cousine, La Boum, Belphégor - Le fantôme du Louvre, La Reine Margot and Jet Lag, which she also directed. She was nominated for the 1976 Academy Award for Writing Original Screenplay for Cousin, cousine. Her 2006 film, Fauteuils d'orchestre was France's entrant for the Academy Award for Best Foreign Film. She is half Jewish from her father,[1] and was on the 1986 Cannes Film Festival jury.[2]In 2010, she was with Isabelle Adjani, Paul Auster, Isabelle Huppert, Milan Kundera, Salman Rushdie, Mathilde Seigner, Jean-Pierre Thiollet and Henri Tisot among the petition's signatures for Roman Polanski when the film director was temporarily arrested by Swiss police at the request of U.S authorities.[1]Thompson's son is the actor Christopher Thompson. They have written screenplays together, most notably those of Jet Lag and Season's Beatings. 获得了法国公民的最高荣誉， 法兰西荣誉军团勋章（军官级）
